headline: Quick Italian Pasta Salad
description: This flavorful Italian pasta salad with salami, bell peppers, red onion, olives, and fresh mozzarella comes together quickly and is sure to be a hit!

video.name: How to Make Italian Pasta Salad

name: Quick Italian Pasta Salad
recipeIngredient: 3 (.7 ounce) packages dry Italian-style salad dressing mix, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook rotini pasta at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water until cool.
Combine pasta, salami, bell peppers, onion, mozzarella balls, and olives in a large bowl. Add salad dressing and toss to coat.
Season pasta salad with dry salad dressing mix and stir to combine. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.

review.reviewBody: The best recipe ever. My husband was licking the empty bowl. I added cherry tomatoes and will go lighter on the red onion next time.

Delicious! Looking for a recipe for a summer family reunion, with no mayo. This was perfect! Even looks nice. Did add halved grape tomatoes, put it over the top!! Did not add dry packet, was afraid of too much salt! Hubby also loved it! Oh and it was gone after the party! So much flavor going on!!

Loved this! I kinda use it more as a measurement system than anything, since I changed a few things. Only one italian seasoning packet (as others have done), replaced mozzarella with provolone, added a half cup extra of italian dressing, and also added pepperoncinis. I use it as meal prep and I never get tired of it!

Yummy and easy. I don't worry about the colour of the peppers - I use whatever I have on hand. Hubby isn't a fan of raw onions, so I add chopped chives instead which are much milder, but still give a hint of onion taste. A good 1/2 cup of parmesan - it is the salt. I throw in small bocconcini if I have them (yum!) . I probably use more veg overall, I add oregano, and I don't use the dry dressing mix.

I only used 1 package of dry Italian dressing mix, otherwise I followed recipe exactly. Personal preference? I would use a high quality pepperoni instead of the salami and I would only use 1/2 pound. I did not care for the dressing at all, but the body of the salad was excellent. I will find a dressing I like better, use pepperoni, but keep the rest of the recipe intact. It was a beautiful presentation.

Okay, before I review this, I have to add that my boyfriend made a recipe up in his head at work, and it turned out to be remarkably close to this one. I was at home looking on here for a recipe that would fit our tastes and found this one. While he was preparing the ingredients, I happen to notice that they were very similar to the ingredients in this recipe. Only a couple of things were different. He added pepperoni and cucumbers instead of the black olives and parmesan cheese and used a 16oz bottle of dressing and 1pkg of the dry instead of what this one called for. It was delicious. We loved it! We plan to follow this recipe next time so we can compare. I was just amazed at how much alike this recipe and his recipe were. Thanks so much to "both" creators. Soooo tasty!
One of my favorites. Delicious!!! Made it exactly like the recipe says.

First time making this type of salad. It was so good. I used red bell pepers instead of green ones. I didnt use olives or dry itailian mix. I only used about 1/2 cup dressing or less to my liking. Red onions gives it a bold spice but I love red onion so amount was great. Awesome recipe my family loved it. I will make again or for potluck for Thanksgiving. Yummy
it is great the only change was salami replaced with sausage
I cut back on the Italian dressing but it was still too strong for me, otherwise I liked at the ingredients. Would try them with a different type of dressing.
I cut back on the Italian dressing but it was still too strong for me, otherwise I liked at the ingredients. Would try them with a different type of dressing.

Excellent recipe. Super simple. It sounds silly but for years I tried to figure out how people made their pasta salads taste so good as the Italian dressing taste seemed to disappear. The dry packets are magic. I tasted the salad after each dry packet addition. You really need all 3. I followed this to the letter. Will make again.
This will be my go-to pasta salad recipe. I kept all ingredients but only added the liquid salad dressing and one packet of dry. Itâ€™s easy and delicious!!
Family loved it, even The Hubs and he likes nothing that is good for him.
I used to fresh ingredients. Instead of using a green pepper I used red and orange. it was a hit at my granddaughter's first birthday party I've been asked to make it again for other parties.

I used this recipe as a base for a really basic pasta salad. The commercial brand that I normally use was out of stock. I didn't want something that was going to take all day to make, but had the same about of flavor. It was a winner with my husband.

Easy and taste great! I would prepare night before or at very least cook pasta, add dressing and envelopes of seasoning (I only used 2 packs as personal taste) and add rest of ingredients next day, this lets flavors absorb. Yummmm
This was so good! I did not add salami ( we donâ€™t eat cold cuts), used only one packet of salad dressing mix, and added halved grape tomatoes and fresh basil. Rave reviews!
I love this pasta salad. I made two changes. I add pepperoni to it with the salami. Instead of dry Italian dressing I use Salad Supreme. My family likes this too.

There is no need to use pre-made Italian dressing and seasoning packets. You can use olive oil and white wine vinegar and some basil and oregano. I have been adding banana peppers to the mix for a nice extra zest.
Everyone keeps asking me to make this salad when I ask what should I bring...
Everyone keeps asking me to make this salad when I ask what should I bring...
Yummy! Fam loves it as well! What's not to love?
Didn't add seasoning packets or as much meat. It needed garlic. We added halved cherry tomatoes.

I made this and my fussy son just asked me if there was any more. I put a little more tomatoes and Mexican cucumbers, black beans, garbanzo beans and some kidney beans. Both of my children couldnâ€™t get enough. Definitely will be making this pasta salad on regular now.
So yummy!! I started with one packet and ended up adding another. Will definitely make again
Great recipe! I only added 1 packet of the dry dressing.

This is the best recipe for pasta salad ever! 
I make this for every event I go to and I always get tons of compliments. The thing that makes this recipe so good is the dry Italian seasoning, it makes all the difference. I start with 2 packs and only add the 3rd if I feel like it needs it. I do add more veggies, like cherry tomatoes, broccoli and cucumber. And I think this is the reason why 3 packs of Italian seasoning works for me because I'm adding more to the salad.
Also.. I have also made it vegetarian and its still just as good.

A few tips.... After pasta is cooked, run cold water over it and then add a little olive oil. Also, try topping it off with McCormick Salad Supreme Seasoning. (you wont be sorry you did.)
Very good and simple salad. Been making this for years. I do omit the dry Italian dressing. Don't feel it's needed.
It calls for way too many dressing packets. It would be fine with none, but is much too strong with three.

It was AWESOME, FULL OF FLAVOR! 
A BIG HIT!
This pasta salad was so good! I served it for a baby shower and had many compliments. Super easy to make and I will definitely make it again!
Delicious! You may need to add and stir in a spot more of the salad dressing after refrigerating for a day or so.
Receive compliments everytime I make it. Thank you!
Made it for friends- and whole family just loved it! The salami and fresh mozzarella added so much flavor- yum. I followed others advice and used only one packet of dry dressing mix
AMAZING!!! Super easy to make and delicious! Brought it to a picnic for a large crowd and everyone loved it! Definitely making again!
Wow delicious. Made it for a farewell BBQ party I had for coworkers who were laid off. It was a hit. Everyone loved it!!! Will definitely make this dish again!!!!
Fantastic! I had not seen a recipie using the dry mix in addition to the salad dressing. Iâ€™m putting that trick in the toolbox! Definitely kicked up the flavor factor!

It is a great pasta salad I added a little extra when it came to the onion and the peppers I did add halved cherry tomatoes too it and I used pepperoni instead of salami but still great I will make this again the next time we cookout

1lb pasta. 1lb salami. 12oz. Moz balls. 1/2 sweet onion. 1/4 yellow pepper. 1 pkg dry dressing mix. 16oz. bottle Italian dressing. Made this for a family reunion and didnâ€™t take any home. I would have given this 5 stars but I donâ€™t consider this recipe quick!!

I don't especially like green or red peppers, so instead used a 3 oz pkg of sun-dried tomatoes with basil. I couldn't find mozzarella balls so just cut up a block. Also only used envelope of Italian dressing mix. It is DELICIOUS, definitely a keeper and will be making this many more times!
Loved it! I did add pepperoni and pepperoncini peppers to mine. Only used one packet of Italian seasoning too.

I used all the ingredients as mentioned with the exception of the following: I omitted the dry italian dressing mix. And in lieu of the one cup of italian dressing, I used equal amounts of bottled italian salad dressing and bottled creamy caesar salad dressing. I'm sure I used more than 1 cup total and likely used about 1 cup of each. I must have used more veggies than called for because it make a lot and by using only one cup of salad dressing, it was too dry. I took this to a pot luck dinner and everyone liked it.
Great Summer Salad. I did add 1 cup Cherry Tomatoes sliced in half, and cheddar cheese cut in 1/2 inch cubes in lieu of mozzarella balls
This made a really big hit! Just put 1 pkg of good seasons.
I took this salad to a church meal. It was very easy to make, and everyone at church liked it! I chopped the peppers a little smaller, but no other differences. Iâ€™ll be making this again!
Turned out great! The whole family loved it. I only used 2 packets of the dry italian dressing and it still had a lot of flavor.

A delicious summer-time meal or any -time-of- year side dish. My 10 ten year old son requests this salad. I didn't have the mozzarella cheese balls on hand so improvised using sliced mozzarella cheese sticks. Yummy! Love this recipe!

This pasta salad was fantastic! I made it for a family gathering and it was a big hit! I followed the directions except for the amount of Italian seasoning packets, I only used one as some of the other reviewers recommended. I will make it again.
I used Feta and zesty Italian dressing for a bit of home. And there is no way i would ever spoil any thing y addding Olives.

Thought I'd use this quick recipe, and I think the one envelope of dry dressing was plenty. Added chopped canned artichokes too. Able to prep all of this the night before, only adding Italian dressing the next day. (I made this for a group of 16, using two boxes of pasta but I think it was too much.)
No changes. The taste is wonderful and all enjoyed it
I made this for a poolside party. It turned out to be a big hit. I did add cherry tomatoes cut in half.
Yum
Fantastic! My husband loved it. It was easy to prepare. Made it with no cheese and I used half a packed of the Dry Italian Dressing. It was delicious. Thanks.
Very yummy! I also added sliced green olives and sliced banana peppers on top. I'll be making this again soon.
Didnâ€™t make any changes, it was t necessary. It was simple to make and just different enough that everyone loved it!! It went faster than I thought. Thank you All Recipes!!
Next time I'll add little less dry Italian dressing. It was still yummy on a hot summer day when you don't want to cook.

Made it the first time as instructions but with 1 packet of the Italian Dressing (due to comments from others who made it). Turned out great! Second time, not so much. I think I let the pasta cook too long and the ingredients got lost in the process because the pasta was too swollen (lol). Will try again and only cook the pasta for 12 minutes or less.
Very easy. Was liked by the family. I used. 12oz box of pasta and used 1.5 packets of the dry dressing.
I never thought to add dry Italian dressing and wet dressing to pasta salad. It really worked well and everyone was happy with the flavor.
This salad is so flavorful. I only use one package of dry Italian dressing mix and it adds great depth to the liquid dressing. I even use this with gluten free pasta for my hubby.
Fantastic recipe I followed others and only used 1 packet of dry italian seasoning. It was a hit at the cookout.
Awesome! Yes definitely would make again. I used champagne dressing which was good choice!
Was easy to make, and tasty. Will do this reciepe again.
I used a single packet of dry Italian salad seasoning
Loved this. Just omitted the onions and bell peppers due to preference. Added tomatoes. My kids loved it and so did I. Best pasta salad recipe I have found.

Loved this pasta salad! It was a hit at the party for sure! Like others, I only used 1 pack of Italian dressing as it was all I had on hand but worked out perfectly! I also substituted 1/2 lb. pepperoni for salami and chunk mozzarella for fresh. This recipe is a keeper!
Really tasty
great pasta salad...every time I make it everyone just loves it!!
I made this recipe but included other ingredients from a different recipe. That's just me and the way I do things sometimes.

I also added a jar of sundries tomatos in oil, so I omitted the red bell pepper. I still used the green bell pepper. Very hearty pasta I would use this as a main dish for a quick meal.
Super quick, easy, and delicious! I added black olives and tomatoes from the garden, too.

This is the best pasta salad I've made. It's so versatile you can change it up to your own taste. The secret ingredient is the "packet" of Italian dressing. I also used one packet as others suggested and Olive Garden Italian Dressing. No added salt was needed. I added mozzarella cheese sticks cut into bite size pieces some blanched baby carrots and grape tomatoes for color and variety. Everyone enjoyed it and this will be my go to pasta salad from now on.

This recipe was fantastic. I had to take a dish to a Church meeting and everyone absolutely loved it. My husband and I did not get to indulge in any of it that day. I made a batch for us the next evening and we understood why I got so many compliments. It was easy, inexpensive and tasted great.
Great pasta salad! I agree that 1 package of dry salad dressing is enough.
Used just 2 dressing packets, 3 was too strong. Added sliced mushrooms & asparagus tips plus replaced the salami with pepperoni . Delish and easy. Thanks Trish.
Great recipe for a go-to Italian pasta salad. We had to add more dressing after it sat for a night.
I made my pasta only with olives and cherry tomatoes. I sprinkled romano/parmesan cheese on top and it came out delicious!

This was a hit at my table, but I have to say, it was a too spicy for me. I'm terrible with spice so I'll definitely use either less or no Italian dressing mix. I'll cut back on the onion either since that too was a bit much. Maybe it's because I used a large red onion instead of a smaller one, but there was too much. I'm a bland person, I know. This salad just packed too much of a punch for me personally. Mom and brother loved it though!
Great to take to a potluck. Everyone enjoyed this dish.
Made this up for my family visiting after long commute. They ate it all up. Served with a loaf of Italian bread. Nothing left. A real treat after eating on the road.

I made this for an Italian potluck at work today. I got many compliments. The one thing I would def do differently is the olives. it calls for 6 oz. I used 2oz can of black and about 3oz kalamata olives (b/c I read a review that said she used those), and it was WAY too many olives and very salty. I also used 1 package of the Italian dry dressing which was sufficient. I used pepperoni since I like that better than salami. Next time I will use only 2oz of black olives or even omit them entirely. Overall this recipe is one of the best I've ever tried and 2 of my compliments were from fantastic cooks.
This is so good! I used zesty Italian dressing and just 1 packet of the dry Italian dressing mix. There's so much you could do to this to make it your own.

Very good! The multi-colored rotini comes in a 16 oz size. 1 pkg of the dry italian dressing is plenty. 12 to 14 oz of both the salami and the mozzarella is plenty. I didn't dice the meat, I cut into more of a chopped size. I used packaged, whole milk mozzarella, instead of the balls (very soft and creamy). I used Olive Garden Italian dressing and made this the night before. The next day I needed to add about a cup more of the dressing. It was the hit of the party that night and I will definitely make this again!

This is a delicious pasta salad. I used pepperoni instead of salami and I cut up mozzarella instead of using fresh mozzarella balls. The cheese doesn't get soggy that way. One packet of Italian seasoning is plenty, I actually used half a packet and it was great. Easy recipe and one to keep.
Love it! Made it exactly to the recipe one time and every last bit got eaten. Now I am making it again but forgot the red onion and red pepper! Hopefully it will still be delicious ??

This is the first time I've made pasta salad. I used this as a base to get an idea of amounts and ran with it. Some ingredients I didn't either have or the kids don't like, so I adapted. Husband loved it and says it'll be a request from now on.

I substituted green Manzanillo olives with pimiento from Spain for black olives, and sliced them in half. The basic salad mixture was very bland, so I added a small amount of salt, pepper, dried oregano and basil and mixed them in. Bingo... the salad came alive as I knew it would.
Add sliced cherry tomatoes and this is a five star recipe. Very good but the tomatoes make it excellent!
Made this as written except added one package of dry pasta salad dressing mix instead of the dry Italian dressing mix. It was a big hit for our pot luck picnic

I made this without the bell peppers and only used 1 packet of dry Italian dressing. I added extra Italian salad dressing and extra parm and cherry tomatoes. The combination of the fresh mozza, hard Italian salami, and sweet cherry tomatoes is divine. It was DELICIOUS and oh, so easy!
very good, will make again

Great start up pasta salad recipe however I made some changes. Instead of italian dressing I found an avocado dressing at the store that I used instead. I did not add the dry italian dressing, thought it would make it too salty. It was fabulous!! I also omitted black olives and used Salad Supreme seasoning from McCormick's that gave it a little extra flavor. I meant to add cucumber but forgot to buy at store but that would make a great addition to this salad. Kids loved it!!!
I added marinated artichoke hearts and Peppercinnis. I also took others' advice and only used one packet of Italian seasoning. I could eat this all to myself! So good! My new go-to side dish!'
Very salty. Only used one packet of dry seasoning. Will not make again.
This was delicious!

Very good pasta salad! I omitted the peppers because we aren't fans and used mini pepperoni instead of the salami because it was quicker. I also only used only 1 packet of the dried Italian dressing. Will make again!

Love how simple and delicious this recipe is - perfect for parties! After looking at other reviews though, I decided to go with just 1 packet instead of the 3 called for, and upped the amount of Italian dressing as well (an additional 1/2 cup). I used pepperoni instead (personal preference) and added a cup of zucchini. Tomato would be a great addition as well. With a few personalized tweaks, I'm super happy!
